Media.MediaTitle: esophageal squamous cell carcinoma stage IB

ImageData.LabelName: Stage IB Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Esophagus

OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Image revisions made per AJCC 8th edition staging

Changed brackets to curly brackets with the label line pointing to the middle of the bracket; added label for Submucosa, pointing to the white band near the top, and made the mucosa layer just include the layers from the top of the submucosa to the top of the image; made the connective tissue layer at the very bottom a little thicker; and extended cancer cells into the submucosa layer
Moved the label "OR" down so that it lines up with the mucosa layer

Removed "Part 1 OR Part 2" labels; widened the white strip in between the two parts of the inset by moving them apart and added the label “OR” in between them; put a bracket around the lower third of the esophagus, changed the label to say “Lower esophagus”, and moved it down closer to the bracket
Made cancer cells in the right side of the inset more yellow; removed "Cancer cells" label and pointed "Cancer" label to both sides of the inset

Combined stage IB (parts 1 and 2) on the same image; split pull-out into two halves, and inserted “OR” between them; put the cancer spot (the one that looks like popcorn) in the left half of the pull-out; in the right half of the pull-out, put the cancer cells going down into the connective tissue; moved the place on the esophagus where the pull-out comes from to the lower third of the esophagus

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Stage IB squamous cell cancer of the esophagus; drawing shows the esophagus and stomach. A two-panel inset shows the layers of the esophagus wall: the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, submucosa layer, thick muscle layer, and connective tissue layer. The lymph nodes are also shown. The left panel shows cancer cells that are any grade or of an unknown grade in the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, and submucosa layer. The right panel shows grade 1 cancer cells in the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, submucosa layer, and thick muscle layer.

Stage IB squamous cell cancer of the esophagus; drawing shows the esophagus and stomach. A two-panel inset shows the layers of the esophagus wall: the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, submucosa layer, thick muscle layer, and connective tissue layer. The lymph nodes are also shown. The left panel shows cancer cells that are any grade or of an unknown grade in the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, and submucosa layer. The right panel shows grade 1 cancer cells in the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, submucosa layer, and thick muscle layer.

Captions.MediaCaption: Stage IB squamous cell cancer of the esophagus. Cancer has spread into the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, or submucosa layer of the esophagus wall. The cancer cells are any grade or the grade is not known; OR cancer has spread into the thick muscle layer of the esophagus wall. The cancer cells are grade 1. Grade 1 cancer cells look more like normal cells under a microscope and grow and spread more slowly than grade 2 and 3 cancer cells.

Stage IB squamous cell cancer of the esophagus. Cancer has spread into the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, or submucosa layer of the esophagus wall. The cancer cells are any grade or the grade is not known; OR cancer has spread into the thick muscle layer of the esophagus wall. The cancer cells are grade 1. Grade 1 cancer cells look more like normal cells under a microscope and grow and spread more slowly than grade 2 and 3 cancer cells.

ProposedUse.Glossary: stage I esophageal squamous cell carcinoma

ProcessingStatus.Comment: Image and caption need modifications per J. Faris
